arm_group.description: lifestyle intervention for obesity delivered to small groups of approximately 12 participants/group
lifestyle intervention for obesity delivered to a large group of approximately 30 participants

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to compare the 6- and 12-month weight changes associated with
      lifestyle interventions delivered in a large group or small groups of participants.  It is
      hypothesized that participants receiving treatment in a small group will have greater weight
      loss than those assigned to a larger group.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Weight Management Programs Delivered in Large Versus Small Groups

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  at least 21 years-old

          -  body mass index (BMI) between 30-45

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  have lost >4.5 kg in past six months

          -  have medical condition(s) likely to affect ability to participate in physical
             activity

          -  planning to relocate from the area in next 12 months

          -  unable or unwilling to attend weekly group sessions

          -  unwilling to accept random assignment

clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of Weight Management Programs Delivered in Large Versus Small Groups

authority: United States: National Institutes of Health

primary_outcome.description: Weight will be measured to the nearest 0.1 kg using calibrated digital scales at baseline, month 6, and month 12.
primary_outcome.measure: change in body weight from baseline to months 6 and 12

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Participants attendance at each treatment group session was recorded.
Participants' self-monitoring of food intake was collected to determine adherence to this component of treatment.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
